item.title: CGI
item.description: Common Gateway Interface Common Gateway Interface (CGI) is an interface specification for web servers to execute command-line interface (CLI) programs. These programs also known as CGI scripts or simply CGIs, are commonly executed at the time a request is made and return dynamically generated HTML content. Most servers expect CGI scripts to reside in a special directory, usually called cgi-bin, to handle the requests correctly and execute the program instead of returning the file content.
